level.text: The articles of incorporation or bylaws of a membership corporation may establish criteria or procedures for admission of members.
A person shall not be admitted as a member without the person's consent.

If a membership corporation provides certificates of membership to the members, the certificates shall not be registered and shall not be able except as otherwise provided in the articles of incorporation or bylaws.
A person shall not be a member of a nonprofit corporation unless the person meets the definition of a "member" in ยง 29-401.02, regardless of whether the corporation refers to the person as a member.
